html: Because the prophecies that were fulfilled anciently relate to the end-time only as types, researching history isn’t as profitable as participating in the “new things” Jehovah is doing or is about to do. With the advent of his servant (Isaiah 42:1-9; 49:1-13; 52:7-15), new realities come into being until the time Jehovah comes in his glory (Isaiah 48:6-7; 52:7-10; 62:1-12). One such “new thing” is the regenerating wilderness, in which Jehovah’s elect people dwell—those whom he “forms” or re-creates, who praise him for reversing covenant curses for their sake (Isaiah 12:4-6; 24:15-16; 42:10-12; 63:7).
